p: Coumarins (6,7-Dimethyl-4-hydroxycoumarin, 7-Methoxy-3-(4-methoxyphenyl) coumarin, 2′-Hydroxy-2,4,4′,5-tetramethoxychalcone coumarin,), Trimethoxycinnamic acid and Phenols (7-Hydroxychromanone and p-Cresol) were also identified. Studies have reported that coumarins as well as phenols exhibited strong antibacterial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative strains by damaging the bacterial cell membrane causing denaturation of protein and affecting cell membrane permeability [ 40, 41].
